channel.title: What else is there to do
channel.description: I have finally managed to connect with a deobbed client (stupid mistake before). And I've had some fun, changing text, colours ect. Nothing to useful. Is there anything else I can do that would be cool/useful with a deob? I don't really mean writing a bot, as thats a bit beyond me at the moment, but something cool, not as trivial as changing 'Walk here' to 'Crap here'. Just a'wondering, as noobies like me tend to do a lot :p Needless to say, I'll probably be banned by morning, thanks for the people who told me to delete uid.dat, assuming it does acctually do something... Unhandled ;)

item.title: What else is there to do
item.dc:creator: @killerjak7 killerjak7
item.description:
@killerjak7 wrote:

i like HP above heads it fun

item.title: What else is there to do
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

You know, I don’t think I did include it… Googles classpath
Thanks.
I had one idea, kinda stupid, but useful. I’ve added in println’s when common methods are called. Such as class21.method198, which seems to be used whenever strings need to be displayed. A small sample of the output:

****Started method198()****
string: Suche nach Updates )2
i: 255
****Started method198()****
string: Lade Konfiguration )2
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: Offline
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: p11_full
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: ,Zffentlicher Chat
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: (Udns
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: Attack
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: Please use a different world)3
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: Enter amount:
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: flash2:
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: bevor Sie den Vorgang wiederholen)3
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: glow3:
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: W-=hlen Sie eine Option
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: Invalid loginserver requested)3
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: This world is running a closed Beta)3
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string: Enter your username (V password)3
i: 255
****End method198()****
****Started method198()****
string:  steht bereits auf Ihrer Ignorieren)2Liste(Q
i: 255
****End method198()****

That method seems to only be called during loading, never during say…an Invalid loginserver is requested.
Kinda stupid, but I guess it can be used to help renaming methods maybe?
If anyone understands what method198 does, I’d like to know. I thought it might some kind of encrytion/compression, but I’m probably wrong.

 public static Class53 method198(int i, String string) {
	System.out.println("****Started method198()****");
	System.out.println("string: " + string);
	System.out.println("i: " + i);
	anInt523++;
	byte[] is = string.getBytes();
	int i_0_ = is.length;
	Class53 class53 = new Class53();
	if (i != 255)
	    aLong529 = -50L;
	class53.aByteArray1870 = new byte[i_0_];
	int i_1_ = 0;
	while ((i_0_ ^ 0xffffffff) < (i_1_ ^ 0xffffffff)) {
	    int i_2_ = is[i_1_++] & 0xff;
	    if ((i_2_ ^ 0xffffffff) < -46 || i_2_ < 40) {
		if (i_2_ != 0)
		    class53.aByteArray1870[class53.anInt1892++] = (byte) i_2_;
	    } else {
		if (i_1_ >= i_0_)
		    break;
		int i_3_ = is[i_1_++] & 0xff;
		class53.aByteArray1870[class53.anInt1892++]
		    = (byte) (i_3_ + (-48 + 43 * (i_2_ - 40)));
	    }
	}
class53.method419((byte) 126);
	System.out.println("****End method198()****");
	return class53.method427((byte) -103);
    }

Read full topic

item.title: What else is there to do

@moparisthebest wrote:

It depends on what the errors were, you probably didn’t have BCEL included in your classpath.

item.title: What else is there to do
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I’ll definitely try the HP above heads thing, what about a loader? What does that do? And an updater? Doesn’t that keep bots and such up to date with new client releases? I would like to get PSB’s loader working, but I’m not sure how to implement it. I tried compiling it, and got 100 errors :S. Am I doing it wrong? Thanks for your help, I really appreciate it!

Read full topic
item.source: What else is there to do

item.title: What else is there to do
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

hp above heads, very good, i found it really fun and i still re-do it every time the client updates, heres the tutorial link http://www.rs-resources.com/e107/e107_plugins/content/content.php?content.54

also, find the runescape main Canvas, then get its Graphics class, use that to draw stuff, like here iv made it snow (doesnt look so good as a screenshot, but its much better when its moving)

tip: the main canvas has listeners added to it, look for ‘addKeyListener’ or something

Read full topic
item.source: What else is there to do

item.title: What else is there to do
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

deobs are very good for trial and error learning what things in the client do, think of something that could be nice in a bot, then try to make it using your deob

Read full topic
